channel.title: Runserver.bat problem
channel.description:
Running a 525
This is my runserver.bat code
[code]@echo off color 69 title Your server is running... java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main pause [/code]
My java is jdk1.6.0_17
This is the error i get when i run my server =/
'\\tsclient\C\Users\John\Desktop\YoungMula\v3.2\youngmula' CMD.EXE was started with the above path as the current directory. UNC paths are not supported. Defaulting to Windows directory. Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/rs2hd/Main Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.rs2hd.Main at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:303) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:316) Could not find the main class: com.rs2hd.Main. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Runserver.bat problem
item.dc:creator: @WEEZYx WEEZYx
item.description:
@WEEZYx wrote:

Yeah well im trying to run it on my vps, works on my regular desktop.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat problem
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“WEEZYx, post:1, topic:313042”]This is my runserver.bat code

@echo off color 69 title Your server is running... java -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.3.jar;deps/slf4j-log4j12-1.5.3.jar;xpp3-1.1.4c.jar;deps/xstream-1.3.1-20081003.103259-2.jar;deps/xpp3-1.1.4c.jar com.rs2hd.Main pause

My java is jdk1.6.0_17[/quote]

Obviously you didnt edit your runserver.bat to ur java version, imo, that server u downloaded, the person using it must of had a weird java version, sorry but im not sure what to say, usually its someone who just didnt edit there java thing, but this one looks too complicated for my java skills.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat problem

Running a 525

This is my runserver.bat code
